Posts.Content: On 1/5/2007 Wclady wrote: I had a simple mastectomy on 12-22-06 and had a drain inserted during surgery.  My surgeon removed the drain on 12-28-06, 6 days after surgery.  I had 15 cc's of fluid recorded for that day.  Over New Year's weekend I got very swollen and uncomfortable.  Saw the surgeon on 1-2-07 and he drained 60 cc's from my breast area.  I returned to surgeon 1-5-07 and had 110 cc's removed!  I have to return to surgeon on 1-8-07.  Does anyone know why I am having so much drainage?  It doesn't seem normal to me. Barbara Barbara, My mastectomy was done in August 2004 and I had a drain in for 5 weeks.  I had it surgically removed when I had my medi-port placed in my shoulder.  I had a lot of drainage and my surgeon seemed to think it was normal even though everything was dry when she closed my incision.  I don't remember the amount of drainage; but it was sufficient to cause me to worry.  I have had no problems whatsoever since.  I believe you are normal.  Perhaps your drain should have been left in for a longer time. Anna
Posts.Title: Excessive drainage after simple mastectomy
